definition: to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on

sentences.english: The word reflects the sky Mr. quarter admiration and worship of the sky.
sentences.chinese: 青天两字体现了季先生对青天的敬仰和崇拜。

sentences.english: The name Baobab commands respect in many sectors of the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 贝欧巴这个名字在银河系许多星区受人敬仰。

sentences.english: He was deeply revered for his ability and sagacity in military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他在军事上的才略深受大家敬仰。

sentences.english: There are admirable potentialities in every human being.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都潜藏着令人敬仰的潜力。

sentences.english: In this city is one of the most revered temples, that of Apollo.
sentences.chinese: 阿波罗神庙是这座城市里最受敬仰的神庙之一。

sentences.english: But say to the Vatican, is a face of admiration.
sentences.chinese: 不过一说到梵蒂冈，倒是一脸敬仰。

sentences.english: "It would", says Mr Lin, "be the heavenly dynasty all over again, and the barbarians coming to worship.
sentences.chinese: 中国将重新成为天朝圣国，野蛮邻人对其敬仰朝拜。

sentences.english: He will be always honoured by the people.
sentences.chinese: 他将永远受到人民的敬仰。

sentences.english: Whith money, you can buy a position, but not respect.
sentences.chinese: 用金钱，你可以买到一个职位，却得不到敬仰。

sentences.english: That would be dreadful, I absolutely revere him.
sentences.chinese: 那会是很可怕的，我绝对敬仰他。

sentences.english: What renders authority legitimate or respectable?
sentences.chinese: 什么使得权力合法化并让人敬仰？

sentences.english: Mr. Luo Zonghai that I admire the leadership and teachers.
sentences.chinese: 罗宗海先生是我敬仰的领导和师长。

sentences.english: Some day all progressive mankind will cherish his memory .
sentences.chinese: 有一天整个进步的人类都会敬仰他的英名。

sentences.english: Question: Which Chelsea legend do you look up to the most?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得切尔西的传奇史最让你敬仰？

sentences.english: Marketing experts say products designed by widely admired figures like Jobs usually see an upsurge in sales after their death.
sentences.chinese: 销售专家称受万众敬仰的乔布斯死后苹果机销量高涨。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to love and respect/love and respect
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to
